tags.name: TForceFreightShipping_other
tags.description:
Only users that plan to ship packages manifested, tendered, and delivered by TForce Freight can use the API.
Business Rules
Appendix
Errors
FAQ
GitHub - view sample integration code

post.description: Only users that plan to ship packages manifested, tendered, and delivered by TForce Freight can use the API.

parameters.name: transId
parameters.description: An identifier unique to the request. Length 32

parameters.name: transactionSrc
parameters.description: An identifier of the client/source application that is making the request.Length 512

parameters.name: version
parameters.description:
When TForce Freight introduces new elements 
in the response that are not associated with new 
request elements, version is used. This ensures 
backward compatibility.
To get such elements you need to have the right 
version. The value of the version is explained in 
the Response element Description.
Example: Itemized Charges are returned only 
when the version element is present and greater 
than or equal to 'v1601'. 
Format: YYMM = Year and month of the release.
Example: v1601 = 2016 Januaryrelease. 
Supported values: v1, v1601, v1607. Length 5

requestBody.description: Generate sample code for popular API requests by selecting an example below. To view a full sample request and response, first click "Authorize" and enter your application credentials, then populate the required parameters above and click "Try it out".

oauth2.description:
Find your Client ID and Secret on your app info page.
1. Select \"Try It\"
2. In the Security section enter your Client ID and Secret.
3. Select \"Request Token\"
4. Enter any additional information in the Body and Parameters sections.
5. Select \"Send\" to execute your API request

RequestOption.description:
Type of Shipping desired.
Valid value: 1 - Ground Freight Shipping

SubVersion.description:
When UPS introduces new elements in the response that are not associated with new request elements, Subversion is used. This ensures backward compatibility.

To get such elements you need to have the right Subversion. The value of the subversion is explained in the Response element Description.

Example: Itemized Charges are returned only when the Subversion element is present and greater than or equal to '1601'. 

Format: YYMM = Year and month of the release.
Example: 1601 = 2016 January
 
Supported values: 1601, 1607

Request_RequestOption.description:
Type of Shipping desired.
Valid value: 1 - Ground Freight Shipping

Request_SubVersion.description:
When UPS introduces new elements in the response that are not associated with new request elements, Subversion is used. This ensures backward compatibility.

To get such elements you need to have the right Subversion. The value of the subversion is explained in the Response element Description.

Example: Itemized Charges are returned only when the Subversion element is present and greater than or equal to '1601'. 

Format: YYMM = Year and month of the release.
Example: 1601 = 2016 January
 
Supported values: 1601, 1607

CommodityValue_CurrencyCode.description:
Commodity value currency code type.
Required when value of commodity is entered. 
Valid values: USD � United States Dollar

PrimeCode.description:
National Motor Freight Classification Commodity prime code.
Must be 6 digits representing the NMFC prime code. 
This field is required if NMFCCommodity/SubCode is supplied.

SubCode.description:
National Motor Freight Classification Commodity sub code.
Must be 2 digits representing the NMFC sub code.
If this field is supplied, NMFCCommodity/PrimeCode also has to be supplied.

Commodity_NMFCCommodity.description:
Container for National Motor Freight Classification Commodity.  This Container is for customers who choose to send the NMFC Prime and sub code as two different fields.
This container is mutually exclusive with NMFCCommodityCode element above.

NMFCCommodity_PrimeCode.description:
National Motor Freight Classification Commodity prime code.
Must be 6 digits representing the NMFC prime code. 
This field is required if NMFCCommodity/SubCode is supplied.

NMFCCommodity_SubCode.description:
National Motor Freight Classification Commodity sub code.
Must be 2 digits representing the NMFC sub code.
If this field is supplied, NMFCCommodity/PrimeCode also has to be supplied.

BarCodeIndicator.description: The presence of the tag BarCodeIndicator indicates that the reference at index 1 is bar-coded.

NumberOfCartons.description:
Number of cartons attached to this reference.
Strongly recommended for ground services.

Shipment_Reference.description:
Reference Container.
Max number of references allowed: 200

Reference Weight Container.

FreezableProtectionIndicator.description: The presence of the tag FreezableProtectionIndicator indicates that the customs clearance is required.

ExtremeLengthIndicator.description:
The presence of the tag ExtremeLengthIndicator indicates that the customs clearance is required.
It is recommended to provide 'LinearFeet' if this indicator is sent.

LinearFeet.description:
Dimensional length of the article(s), in 'feet'.
Numeric value greater than �0� (Zero) should be given in LinearFeet.
If Proper LinearFeet is not provided, accurate charge for extreme length articles might not be returned.
If linear feet �0� (Zero) or any non-numeric/invalid character is sent, accurate charge for extreme length articles might not be returned.
Ignored if ExtremeLengthIndicator is not present.

EmailInformation Container.
Multiple Email Information Containers with the same EMail Type Code is not allowed.

DeliveryOptions_HolidayDeliveryIndicator.description: The presence of the tag HolidayDeliveryIndicator indicates that the shipment is going to be delivered on a holiday.

DeliveryOptions_InsideDeliveryIndicator.description: The presence of the tag InsideDeliveryIndicator indicates that the shipment requires an inside delivery.

DeliveryOptions_ResidentialDeliveryIndic.description: The presence of the tag ResidentialDeliveryIndicator indicates that the shipment requires a residential delivery.

DeliveryOptions_WeekendDeliveryIndicator.description: The presence of the tag WeekendDeliveryIndicator indicates that the shipment is going to be delivered on a weekend.

DeliveryOptions_LiftGateRequiredIndicato.description: The presence of the tag LiftGateRequiredIndicator indicates that the shipment requires a lift gate.

DeliveryOptions_LimitedAccessDeliveryInd.description: The presence of the tag LimitedAccessDeliveryIndicator indicates that there is limited access for delivery.

Volume.description:
Represents the size as volume.

Volume being required if height, length, width is not specified. 
If volume is present then height, length, width is ignored.

Valid characters: 0-9 and "." (Decimal). 
Maximum of 2 digits after the decimal. 
Maximum field length: 16 characters. The decimal ".", does not count as a character.
Examples:
##############.##
###############.#
################

ShipmentServiceOptions_FreezableProtecti.description: The presence of the tag FreezableProtectionIndicator indicates that the customs clearance is required.

ShipmentServiceOptions_ExtremeLengthIndi.description:
The presence of the tag ExtremeLengthIndicator indicates that the customs clearance is required.
It is recommended to provide 'LinearFeet' if this indicator is sent.

ShipmentServiceOptions_LinearFeet.description:
Dimensional length of the article(s), in 'feet'.
Numeric value greater than �0� (Zero) should be given in LinearFeet.
If Proper LinearFeet is not provided, accurate charge for extreme length articles might not be returned.
If linear feet �0� (Zero) or any non-numeric/invalid character is sent, accurate charge for extreme length articles might not be returned.
Ignored if ExtremeLengthIndicator is not present.

PickupDate.description:
Date of the Pickup. 
Format: YYYYMMDD.
Ground pickup may be scheduled up to 42 days in the future.
Note: This element will act as PickupDate or DropOffDate based on the presence of PickupTimeReady or DropOffTimeReady element.

EarliestTimeReady.description:
The earliest time a shipment is ready to be picked up.
The time is on a 24 hour clock. 
Format: HHMM
HH = Hour values 00 to 23
MM = Minute values 00 to 59

LatestTimeReady.description:
The latest time a shipment can be picked up. Can be also referred as the Closing Time for a pickup time window.
The time is on a 24 hour clock. 
Format: HHMM
HH = Hour values 00 to 23
MM = Minute values 00 to 59
Optional if the account type is House.

ThirdPartyIndicator.description: Indicates whether the requester is Consignee, Third Party, Shipper, other.

PickupRequest_Requester.description:
Requester Container. Also referred to as caller.
Required for ground shipments if PickupRequest container is present.

Requester_ThirdPartyIndicator.description: Indicates whether the requester is Consignee, Third Party, Shipper, other.

PickupRequest_PickupDate.description:
Date of the Pickup. 
Format: YYYYMMDD.
Ground pickup may be scheduled up to 42 days in the future.
Note: This element will act as PickupDate or DropOffDate based on the presence of PickupTimeReady or DropOffTimeReady element.

PickupRequest_EarliestTimeReady.description:
The earliest time a shipment is ready to be picked up.
The time is on a 24 hour clock. 
Format: HHMM
HH = Hour values 00 to 23
MM = Minute values 00 to 59

PickupRequest_LatestTimeReady.description:
The latest time a shipment can be picked up. Can be also referred as the Closing Time for a pickup time window.
The time is on a 24 hour clock. 
Format: HHMM
HH = Hour values 00 to 23
MM = Minute values 00 to 59
Optional if the account type is House.

POMNumber.description: An identifier associated to the pickup request (may or may not be created by the user)

POMNumberType.description:
Identifies the kind of number used to identify the POM shipment.
For valid values, see POMNumberType Values in the Appendix.

POM_POMNumber.description: An identifier associated to the pickup request (may or may not be created by the user)

POM_POMNumberType.description:

For valid values, see POMNumberType Values in the Appendix.

FailedEMail.description: Alternate email address to receive failure notifications

EMailAddress.description: Email address which should receive pre-pickup notification

EventType.description:
Type of event for POM Notification. Add up to four events.
01 = PICKUP_REQUEST_CONFIRM
02 = DRIVER_EN_ROUTE
03 = PICKUP_SECURED
04 = PICKUP_EXCEPTION

EMailNotification_EMailAddress.description: Email address which should receive pre-pickup notification

EMailNotification_EventType.description:
Type of event for POM Notification. Add up to four events.
01 = PICKUP_REQUEST_CONFIRM
02 = DRIVER_EN_ROUTE
03 = PICKUP_SECURED
04 = PICKUP_EXCEPTION

PickupNotifications_FailedEMail.description: Alternate email address to receive failure notifications

Number of Labels to print per page.
Required when label type is �Label�. Otherwise the element and child elements are ignored.

4 X 64 X 88 X 11 (Recommended for Laser Printer type)

Name.description: The shipper�s name or company name.

Name.description: The Consignee�s name or company name.

PackingList_Reference.description: Reference Container. Only two references are allowed. If more than 2 references are provided, then only the first two will be used and the subsequent reference containers will be ignored.

TotalWeight.description: Total weight of all the commodities.

CurrencyCode.description: Currency code. This value applies to the unit price of all the commodities.

Description.description: Description of articles, special marks, freight codes.

HandlingUnit_TotalWeight.description: Total weight of all the commodities.

HandlingUnit_CurrencyCode.description: Currency code. This value applies to the unit price of all the commodities.

HandlingUnits_Type.description: Handling Unit Type for Density based Rating.

Width.description: The width of the line item used to determine the density based rating.

Height.description: The height of the line item used to determine density based rating.

HandlingUnits_Dimensions.description: Dimension of the handling unit for density based pricing.

Shipment_DensityEligibleIndicator.description: The presence of the tag DensityEligibleIndicator indicates that the density based rate is requested.

Code.description:
Identifies the success or failure of the transaction. 
1 = Successful

ResponseStatus_Code.description:
Identifies the success or failure of the transaction. 
1 = Successful

Code.description: Warning code returned by the system.

Alert_Description.description: Warning messages returned by the system.

CustomerContext.description: The CustomerContext Information which will be echoed during response.

DeliveryDate.description:
Estimated date that the shipment will be delivered.  
Format: YYYYMMDD.

ShipmentNumber.description: The shipment Number assigned to the shipment.

BOLID.description: The retrieval key for the stored BOL.

GuaranteedIndicator.description: This indicator indicates that the rate returned is guaranteed. Can only be returned if the billing option is prepaid.

MinimumChargeAppliedIndicator.description: This is an empty tag. The presence of the tag indicates the rate returned has a minimum charge applied to it. Can only be returned if the billing option is prepaid.

ShipmentResults_DeliveryDate.description:
Estimated date that the shipment will be delivered.  
Format: YYYYMMDD.

ShipmentResults_BOLID.description: The retrieval key for the stored BOL.

ShipmentResults_GuaranteedIndicator.description: This indicator indicates that the rate returned is guaranteed. Can only be returned if the billing option is prepaid.

ShipmentResults_MinimumChargeAppliedIndi.description: This is an empty tag. The presence of the tag indicates the rate returned has a minimum charge applied to it. Can only be returned if the billing option is prepaid.

ShipmentResults_Rate.description: Rate Container. Returned only if the billing option is prepaid.
